p: The antiviral activity of both compounds against DENV-2 was proven in VERO and LLCMK2 cells treated with caffeoylcalleryanin and verbascoside for 48 h (EC 50: 2.8 ± 0.4 μg/mL, SI: 20.0 and 3.4 ± 0.4 μg/mL, SI: 3.8, respectively) [ 165], but the mechanism of action was not elucidated. However, this kind of catechol compound, such as dicaffeoylquinic acid (DCQA) and related dicaffeoyltartaric acid, L-chicoric acid, has been shown to be involved in HIV-RT polymerase inhibition (IC 50: 7–107 µM and 17 µM, respectively), HIV integrase inhibition (IC 50: 7–107 µM and 17 µM, respectively) [ 166], and HCV replication inhibition by 3,5-DCQA (100 µM, 53%) [ 167].
